Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and a plant without water to show how they look different.
The student can show in their drawing that plants with water look healthy and plants without water look wilted or dry.
The student can include sunlight in their drawing to indicate that plants need light to live and grow.
The student can illustrate how a plant that has both water and sunlight appears to be thriving and growing well.
The student can depict the effects of no water on plants by drawing comparisons, such as a wilting plant versus a healthy plant.
